description:
This is a library module offering a part of the set of functions
 defined by Microsoft Excel 2003.

functions.name: abs
functions.description:
Compute the abs of a numeric value.
 The value can also be a string and it will be casted to the appropriate numeric first.
functions.summary: Compute the abs of a numeric value.

parameters.name: arg
parameters.description: The parameter can be a number, string, boolean value.

returns.description: The abs value as a numeric type.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if arg cannot be casted to numeric type.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: cast-as-numeric
functions.description:
Cast the xs:anyAtomicType to a numeric type.
 If the value is already of a numeric type then nothing is changed.
 Otherwise the value is casted to the numeric type that is most appropriate.
functions.summary: Cast the xs:anyAtomicType to a numeric type.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The parameter can be a number, string, boolean value.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if the value cannot be casted to numeric type.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: ceiling
functions.signature: ($number as xs:anyAtomicType, $significance as xs:anyAtomicType) as xs:anyAtomicType
functions.description:
Returns number rounded up, away from zero, to the nearest multiple of significance.
 Significance must have the same sign as number.
 Number and significance must be of a numeric type or castable to numeric.
 Significance must not be zero.
functions.summary: Returns number rounded up, away from zero, to the nearest multiple of significance.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The value you want to round.

parameters.name: significance
parameters.description: The multiple to which you want to round.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if parameters cannot be casted to numeric type.</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Num if significance is zero or it doesn't have the same sign as number.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: degrees
functions.description: Converts radians into degrees.
functions.summary: Converts radians into degrees.

parameters.name: radian
parameters.description: The value in radians.

functions.name: even
functions.description:
Returns number rounded up to the nearest even integer.
 Regardless of the sign of number, a value is rounded up when adjusted away from zero.
functions.summary: Returns number rounded up to the nearest even integer.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The value to round.

returns.description: The rounded value casted as numeric type.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if parameters cannot be casted to numeric type.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: fact
functions.description: Returns the factorial of a number.
functions.summary: Returns the factorial of a number.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The nonnegative number you want the factorial of. If number is not an integer, it is truncated.

returns.description: Returns the factorial of a number. The factorial of a number is equal to 1*2*3*...* number.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Num if the number is smaller than zero</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: factdouble
functions.description:
Returns the double factorial of a number.
 Computes the double factorial of n as n(n-2)(n-4)...
functions.summary: Returns the double factorial of a number.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The positive integer value.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Num if the number is negative.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: floor
functions.signature: ($number as xs:anyAtomicType, $significance as xs:anyAtomicType) as xs:anyAtomicType
functions.description:
Rounds number down, toward zero, to the nearest multiple of significance.
 Significance must have the same sign as number.
functions.summary: Rounds number down, toward zero, to the nearest multiple of significance.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The value you want to round. The value is casted to numeric.

parameters.name: significance
parameters.description: The multiple to which you want to round.

returns.description: The rounded value as numeric type.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if parameters cannot be casted to numeric type.</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Num if significance is zero or it doesn't have the same sign as number.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: gcd
functions.description:
Returns the greatest common divisor GCD of a sequence of integers.
 The sequence can have one or more positive integers.
functions.summary: Returns the greatest common divisor GCD of a sequence of integers.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: The sequence of positive integers.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Num if any number is smaller than zero.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: int
functions.description:
Rounds a number down to the nearest integer.
 Positive numbers are rounded toward zero, negative numbers are rounded away from zero.
functions.summary: Rounds a number down to the nearest integer.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The value to be rounded.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if parameter cannot be casted to numeric type</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: is-a-number
functions.description:
Checks if the xs:anyAtomicType argument is actually a numeric type
 or can be converted to numeric.
functions.summary: Checks if the xs:anyAtomicType argument is actually a numeric type or can be converted to numeric.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Parameter to be checked.

returns.description: true if the value can be casted to numeric.

functions.name: lcm
functions.description:
Returns the least common multiple of integers.

LCM for two numbers is computed by multiplying them and dividing with GCD.

The function is applied recursively replacing the first two numbers in the sequence with their LCM.
functions.summary: Returns the least common multiple of integers.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: The sequence of one or more positive integers.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Num if any number is smaller than zero.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: mod
functions.signature: ($number as xs:anyAtomicType, $divisor as xs:anyAtomicType) as xs:anyAtomicType
functions.description:
Returns the remainder after number is divided by divisor.
 The result has the same sign as divisor.
functions.summary: Returns the remainder after number is divided by divisor.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number for which you want to find the remainder.

parameters.name: divisor
parameters.description: The number by which you want to divide number. This cannot be zero.

returns.description: The remainder from division as numeric type.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if parameters cannot be casted to numeric type.</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Div0 if divisor is zero after casting to numeric.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: mround
functions.signature: ($number as xs:anyAtomicType, $multiple as xs:anyAtomicType) as xs:anyAtomicType
functions.description:
Returns a number rounded to the desired multiple.
 MROUND rounds up, away from zero, if the remainder of dividing number by multiple
 is greater than or equal to half the value of multiple.
 MROUND is computed through floor function.
functions.summary: Returns a number rounded to the desired multiple.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The value to round, castable to numeric type.

parameters.name: multiple
parameters.description: The multiple to which you want to round number.

returns.description: The rounded number up to the desired multiple.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if parameters cannot be casted to numeric type.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: odd
functions.description: Returns number rounded up to the nearest odd integer, away from zero.
functions.summary: Returns number rounded up to the nearest odd integer, away from zero.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The value to round.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if parameter cannot be casted to numeric type.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: pi
functions.description: Return the value of PI as decimal with 15 digits.
functions.summary: Return the value of PI as decimal with 15 digits.

returns.description: The value of PI with 15 digits.

functions.name: power
functions.signature: ($number as xs:anyAtomicType, $power as xs:integer) as xs:anyAtomicType
functions.description:
Returns the result of a number raised to a power.
 The result is computed through successive multiplications.
functions.summary: Returns the result of a number raised to a power.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The base number.

parameters.name: power
parameters.description: The exponent as integer (cannot be floating point like in Excel).

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if parameter cannot be casted to numeric type.</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if power is smaller than zero.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: product
functions.description: Multiplies all the numbers given as arguments and returns the product.
functions.summary: Multiplies all the numbers given as arguments and returns the product.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: The sequence of arguments convertable to numeric types. The sequence can be of any length.

returns.description: The multiplication result as numeric type.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if parameters cannot be casted to numeric type.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: quotient
functions.signature: ($numerator as xs:anyAtomicType, $denominator as xs:anyAtomicType) as xs:integer
functions.description: Returns the integer portion of a division.
functions.summary: Returns the integer portion of a division.

parameters.name: numerator
parameters.description: The divident.

parameters.name: denominator
parameters.description: The divisor. It cannot be zero.

returns.description: The result value as numeric type.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if parameters cannot be casted to numeric type.</xqdoc:error>
<xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Div0 if denominator casted as numeric type has value zero.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: radians
functions.description: Converts degrees to radians.
functions.summary: Converts degrees to radians.

parameters.name: degree
parameters.description: An angle in degrees that you want to convert.

functions.name: roman
functions.description:
Converts an arabic numeral to roman, as text. Only the clasic format is supported (out of all formats Excel requires).

M is the largest digit, it represents 1000. Numbers bigger than 2000 will be represented by a sequence of "M".

D = 500, C = 100, L = 50, X = 10, V = 5, I = 1.
functions.summary: Converts an arabic numeral to roman, as text.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: A positive integer.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Num if the input integer is negative</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: round
functions.signature: ($number as xs:anyAtomicType, $precision as xs:integer) as xs:anyAtomicType
functions.description:
Rounds a number to a specified number of digits.
 If precision is greater than 0 (zero), then number is rounded
 to the specified number of decimal places.
 If num_digits is 0, then number is rounded to the nearest integer.
 If num_digits is less than 0, then number is rounded to the left of the decimal point.
 The 0.5 is rounded away from zero.
functions.summary: Rounds a number to a specified number of digits.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number to round, castable to a numeric type.

parameters.name: precision
parameters.description: The number of decimal places to keep.

returns.description: The rounded number as numeric type.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if parameters cannot be casted to numeric type.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: rounddown
functions.signature: ($number as xs:anyAtomicType, $precision as xs:integer) as xs:anyAtomicType
functions.description:
Rounds a number down, toward zero.
 If num_digits is greater than 0 (zero), then number is rounded down
 to the specified number of decimal places.
 If num_digits is 0, then number is rounded down to the nearest integer.
 If num_digits is less than 0, then number is rounded down to the left of the decimal point.
functions.summary: Rounds a number down, toward zero.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number to round, castable to numeric type.

parameters.name: precision
parameters.description: The number of decimal places to keep.

returns.description: the truncated number toward zero, as numeric type.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if parameters cannot be casted to numeric type.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: roundup
functions.signature: ($number as xs:anyAtomicType, $precision as xs:integer) as xs:anyAtomicType
functions.description:
Rounds a number up, away from 0 (zero).
 If num_digits is greater than 0 (zero), then number is rounded down
 to the specified number of decimal places.
 If num_digits is 0, then number is rounded down to the nearest integer.
 If num_digits is less than 0, then number is rounded down to the left of the decimal point.
functions.summary: Rounds a number up, away from 0 (zero).

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number to round, castable to numeric type.

parameters.name: precision
parameters.description: The number of decimal places to keep.

returns.description: The truncated number away from zero, as numeric type.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if parameters cannot be casted to numeric type.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: sign
functions.description:
Determines the sign of a number.
 Returns 1 if the number is positive, zero (0) if the number is 0,
 and -1 if the number is negative.
functions.summary: Determines the sign of a number.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The argument castable to numeric type.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if parameters cannot be casted to numeric type.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: sort-numbers
functions.description:
Helper function.

Sorts a sequence of numbers or arguments castable to numeric. It first casts all arguments to numeric and then sorts ascending.
functions.summary: Helper function.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: The sequence of arguments castable to numeric.

returns.description: The sorted sequence as numeric types.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if parameters cannot be casted to numeric type.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: sum
functions.description: Adds all the numbers in the sequence.
functions.summary: Adds all the numbers in the sequence.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: The sequence of arguments castable to numeric types. The sequence can be of any length.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if parameters cannot be casted to numeric type.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: trunc
functions.description: Truncates a number to an integer by removing the fractional part of the number.
functions.summary: Truncates a number to an integer by removing the fractional part of the number.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The argument castable to numeric type.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if parameter cannot be casted to numeric type.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: trunc
functions.signature: ($number as xs:anyAtomicType, $precision as xs:integer) as xs:anyAtomicType
functions.description:
Truncates a number down to precision.
 This behaves exactly like rounddown.
functions.summary: Truncates a number down to precision.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The argument castable to numeric type.

parameters.name: precision
parameters.description: The number of decimal places to keep .

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if parameter cannot be casted to numeric type.</xqdoc:error>
